com.microsoft.ProjectOxford

Class SpeechAudioFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.ProjectOxford.SpeechAudioFormat

  • public class SpeechAudioFormat
extends java.lang.Object
    The SpeechAudioFormat contains information about how the audio data was recorded and stored including the type of compression used, number of channels, sample rate, bits per sample and other attributes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int AverageBytesPerSecond
      This value indicates how many bytes of audio data must be streamed to a D/A converter per second in order to play the audio.
      short BitsPerSample
      The number of significant bits in each audio sample.
      short BlockAlign
      The number of data bytes per sample slice.
      short ChannelCount
      The number of separate audio signals in the audio data.
      AudioCompressionType EncodingFormat
      Specifies the type of compression used on the audio data as a short.
      byte[] FormatSpecificData
      Extra bytes for use to describe parameters to certain audio compression types.
      int SamplesPerSecond
      Audio sample slices per second (one slice includes all the channel samples).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SpeechAudioFormat() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static SpeechAudioFormat create16BitPCMFormat(int sampleRate)
      Produces a SpeechAudioFormat for 16-bit PCM data.
      static SpeechAudioFormat createSiren7Format(int sampleRate)
      Produces a SpeechAudioFormat for data encoded in Siren7.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • AverageBytesPerSecond

        public int AverageBytesPerSecond
        This value indicates how many bytes of audio data must be streamed to a D/A converter per second in order to play the audio.

      • BitsPerSample

        public short BitsPerSample
        The number of significant bits in each audio sample. Usually 16 or 24.

      • BlockAlign

        public short BlockAlign
        The number of data bytes per sample slice.

      • ChannelCount

        public short ChannelCount
        The number of separate audio signals in the audio data. A value of 1 means a mono signal, a value of 2 means a stereo signal, etc.

      • EncodingFormat

        public AudioCompressionType EncodingFormat
        Specifies the type of compression used on the audio data as a short. Default value is PCM. Use getEncodingFormat or setEncodingFormat to use this short as a AudioCompressionType.

      • FormatSpecificData

        public byte[] FormatSpecificData
        Extra bytes for use to describe parameters to certain audio compression types. This field should be null for PCM.

      • SamplesPerSecond

        public int SamplesPerSecond
        Audio sample slices per second (one slice includes all the channel samples). Thus this value is unaffected by the number of channels.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpeechAudioFormat

        public SpeechAudioFormat()

    • Method Detail

      • createSiren7Format

        public static SpeechAudioFormat createSiren7Format(int sampleRate)
        Produces a SpeechAudioFormat for data encoded in Siren7. The data must be encoded in mono, such that a 320 sample mono input frame produces a 40 bytes output frame.
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - The samples per second of the audio that was encoded (can only by 8000 or 16000).
        Returns:
        The created SpeechAudioFormat.

      • create16BitPCMFormat

        public static SpeechAudioFormat create16BitPCMFormat(int sampleRate)
        Produces a SpeechAudioFormat for 16-bit PCM data.
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - The samples per second of the audio that was encoded (can only by 8000 or 16000).
        Returns:
        The created SpeechAudioFormat.
